content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
• Common Input Chest (Wooden Chest) at (2.5, 0.5)
• New Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
• Sink Chest (Wooden Chest) at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Sink Inserter (Burner Inserter) at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
• Transport Belt Connection linking the drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5) with updated Electrical Connection
Consists of:
• Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on Automation in progress)
• Electricity Network formed by Small Electric Poles (e.g. ElectricityGroup id=1281) connecting the lab to power sources

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) (status: NO_FUEL; fuel insertion incomplete)
• Offshore Pump at (0.5, 30.5) (status: WORKING)
• Steam Engines:
 – (19.5, 14.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”)
 – (13.5, 17.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings)
 – (11.5, 20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings)
Note: Multiple recent attempts to place an additional Steam Engine near the Boiler’s steam output (candidates such as (6.5, 20.5), (7.0, 21.0), (7.5, 19.0), (10.0, 20.0) and a candidate from nearest_buildable ((19.5, 19.0)) have all been rejected due to placement constraints, so no new engine has been integrated.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Candidate Coordinate Viability:
 – Repeated failure of placement attempts (with candidate coordinates like (6.5, 20.5), (7.0, 21.0), (7.5, 19.0), (10.0, 20.0) and (19.5, 19.0)) indicates that the computed positions are in obstructed or non‑buildable areas.
 – Reassess and adjust BuildingBox dimensions and offsets to ensure adequate clearance before making placement attempts.

• API Usage and Attribute Access:
 – Avoid treating Position objects as callable. For example, instead of using buildable_area.center() (which triggers a TypeError), access the center attribute correctly or call the proper method.
 – Validate function parameters and ensure correct order and type to prevent similar type errors.

• Pre-Placement Verification:
 – Systematically use can_place_entity to confirm candidate viability before proceeding with placement.
 – Ensure environmental checks and alignment conditions (such as for pipe endpoints or electrical connections) are thoroughly performed prior to action.

• General API Misuse:
 – When invoking entity-related functions (for example, those handling pickup and insertion), verify that all arguments (including Position objects) are correctly referenced and ordered to avoid misplacement and operational inconsistencies.
